page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY IN LYTHE
page.content:
{ LOCAL HISTORY}
{MULGRAVE ESTATE:-} The Mulgrave Estate has been in existence for centuries and consequently has a deep influence on the area.Prior to the Norman Conquest it was thought to be owned by Suuen-a Dane.Since 1086 it has been owned by the Fossard,the de Mauley, the Bigod, the Radcliffe,the Sheffield and the Phipps families.The present Marquis is the 4th in the line and was Lord-Lt. of the N. Riding from 1965 to 1974 and since 1974 Lord-Lt.of North Yorkshire. {ALUM WORKS:-}The art of alum making came to the area from Italy.An alum works was started at Sandsend Ness about 1615. This brought employment and wealth to the area and since its decline this has not been replaced.
